In this battle the French, under Marshall Grouchy, won a tactical victory, but it meant nothing with the loss of the Battle of Waterloo by the Emperor. This battle pits the French III, IV, I and II Cavalry Corps against the Prussian III Korps. The French move on the town of Wavre in order to attempt to cross the Dyle River and cut off the ability of the Prussians to move to Waterloo, but he is too late.

201366.name: Homefront!
201366.description:
From publisher blurb:

Homefront is a set of four mini-adventures set in North America in 1939 to 1941, prior to the entrance of the United States into World War II. The adventures are designed for player-characters of medium power and fairly small numbers (two to four). In addition to these four adventures is a fifth element called an Integrated Optional Upgrade (IOU).

201367.name: Penchant for Adventure - 3
201367.description:
From publisher blurb:

Penchant for Adventure – 3 is the solo adventure for a 3rd level character. This adventure begins with a message delivery to the post commander in Penchant. Sadly for your PC Lt. Kateryn Hawtrey is gone and the PC will need to wait until her return. While wandering through town yelling is heard and someone is in trouble. Investigation reveals that a small child has fallen into one of the town’s wells and needs help getting out. While forming a rescue plan the child, CeCe, screams and disappears from sight. Is your player brave enough to venture into the darkness alone? As with all adventures in the Penchant series it can be difficult and not for the faint of heart!

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 3rd level solo adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system.

201368.description:
Icomega is a short and simple Paper and Pencil game derived from Omega, by the same designer, that is played on the faces of a regular polihedron (such as an icosahedron, a D30, a D60 or a D120).

2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing one stone of each colour on any two empty faces of the polihedron.

When all faces have been occupied the game ends. Each player multiplies the sizes of all groups of her colour. The highest score wins. Icomega is very drawish for a small number of faces.
201368.name: Icomega

201369.name: Sneak, Steal & Squabble
201369.description: A family fun, mischievous game of goblins stealing treasure from the kings castle. Players take on the roles of 3 goblins belonging to four different factions. Use your actions wisely to move around the castle and steal the treasure, when the alarm sounds, the castle will lock down and all players will need to race to the exit and escape with their treasure. the goblin faction with the most treasure wins the game.

201370.name: Infinite Threats 09
201370.description:
From publisher blurb:

Need a few alien critters to kill off in your Infinite Futures Games? Are your players bored with blasting droids and robots? Avalon is offering you new threats for your team to encounter, where each menace is a fully detailed creature, usable as part of the Fringe setting or in any game you are running.

Explore the danger of space with new threat expansions released for the Infinite Futures system.

201371.name: The Derelict
201371.description:
From the back cover:

A Tale of Terror by Sandy Petersen

The icy waters of the North Atlantic hold many secrets. One such secret is about to be discovered...

Despite the concerns and worries of life, a final voyage is being made on the luxury yacht, Delilah, taking the vessel from America to its new owner in England. What promises to be a pleasurable journey across the ocean waves descends into a desperate struggle for survival.

Set in the modern-day, The Derelict is suitable for up to six players and can be played in a single session. Guidance is provided for helping the players to create a range of player characters.

A stranded vessel. The promise of a great reward. A mystery filled with horror.

201372.name: Red Cross
201372.description:
From publisher blurb:

End of Civilization: A row of short, stubby watchposts marks the edge of civilization, what little there is of civilization out in the wastelands. The Yuli tribe are the only ones fool enough to live out this far and man those towers. But the Yuli never speak to anyone, and do little other than watch the lines of the desert and record things on their stone tablets. Succumb out in the no-man's land beyond their towers and they will do nothing to save you; they merely silently record your passing.

...Only the greatest of fools walk out into the desert beyond those towers. Yet, rumors speak of a land somewhere on the other side of that desert, a land that has not yet been laid to waste. There are many fools willing to try.

201373.name: Kung-Fu Kuma: Barbarian Races
201373.description:
From publisher blurb:

A great martial arts supplement for use with Kung Fu Kuma!

Barbarian Races of Kung Fu Kuma is an expansion book for the Kung Fu Kuma campaign world and the Pathfinder Game System™. It expands the list of available PC races by six, and it further includes one companion race (for use as friends, allies, loyal servants, and henchman, as well as NPCs). That's seven new races available for Kung Fu Kuma campaigns, six directly for use as Player Characters.

One thing about all these races—they are Animal Folk. That is a given in the campaign world of Kung Fu Kuma. But if you purchased this book intending it for use in a different game setting or universe, all of these races are compatible with the general Pathfinder Game System™, though the Gamemaster will have to come up with some reason why Animal Folk exist in that campaign world.

Six New PC Races!

The various peoples of the barbarian lands around Qiu Sang are mostly Human. Not all, though. A wide variety of Animal Folk eke their lives out amongst the barbarian hordes. Some scholars even speculate that every animal out there has an Animal Folk equivalent. This isn't anything close to being a proven theory, however.

For one reason or another, a number of Animal Folk races live solely out in the barbarian lands, ignoring the safety and civilization of Qiu Sang. This Races sourcebook details seven Animal Folk races who are important amongst the barbarian tribes, six of them available as PC races. Many more races than that exist amongst the jungles and plains of the barbarian lands, but these seven are the ones most encountered when traversing barbarian lands.

Because these are barbarian races, PCs of these races are going to be restricted from taking the 12 Clans Classes of Qiu Sang. As barbarians, and likely proud of their heritage, they will be taking levels in Barbarian Classes alone. It is a part of the price one pays for living apart from Qiu Sang.

201374.name: Player's Advantage: Rogue & Purloined Pages Combo
201374.description:
From publisher blurb:

Revisit the works of Mystic Eye Games with Samurai Sheepdog as we bring back popular supplements from the past like Player's Advantage - Rogue and its web enhancement, the Purloined Pages!

Delve into your favorite classes with new rules, variant classes, prestige classes, and other exciting additions. For the new player, you'll find helpful information to develop your character from both a rules and role-playing standpoint. Experienced players will discover ample new options to breathe new life into old classes. Game Masters, do not despair, there are helpful chapters for you as well! Easily choose class combinations to create unique NPCs using detailed charts for multiclassed characters. New NPC classes and sample NPCs makes it easy to add new flavor to your game. The series also builds on proven Open Game Content, taking it to new heights by integrating it into the new material. Don't be satisfied with just any expansion book, take the advantage!

The series begins with Player's Advantage: Rogue-it's so good, it's criminal!

Archetypes detailing numerous types of rogues, their tactics, outlook, recommended feats, races, and variations give old and new players a fresh look at the rogue.
Numerous feats expand the rogue's abilities, taking him in new directions and new heights.
New PC, NPC, and prestige classes provide plentiful alternatives to the core rogue.
Killer combos let you, at a glance, compare multiclassing options to choose the right character for the job. Useful for planning PCs or creating NPCs, these charts include character concepts and related archetypes to aid in choosing feats, skills, and other game mechanics.
New equipment makes the dirty work easier and more exciting with exotic toys for the scoundrel at heart.
And tons more! Uncover the secrets of the rogue and see the class with new eyes.

201375.name: Bloodlines of Darkness: A Trinity of Sorcerous Origins
201375.description:
From publisher blurb:

Have you ever enjoyed playing a darker character, perhaps someone that cares little for the greater good, or simply someone with a moral flexibility?

This is but a mere glimpse of greater horrors to come, this product features a number of new character options, or just a few new options for antagonists. Much of these will be included in a future supplement, however, we wished to pull back the curtain and reveal"

Three new Sorcerer Bloodlines:

Mistwalkers: the bloodline from the Ethereal Realm
Infernal: scion of devils and demons
Deathborn: the children of vampires




Several new vile magic spells, including Festering Grasp and Unholy Transformation.

Three new magic items including the Writhing Blade.

201376.name: En5ider (Issue 80 - May 2016)
201376.description:
From publisher blurb:

We reach our 80th article with this guide to making 5th Editon low-level play more compelling. Steven Willian Zundel 2nd offers a dozen useful edicts which are designed to help you create gripping experiences right from the start of a party's adventuring career.

201377.name: Haunted (2016)
201377.description:
The Curious Case of the Ghostly Wails

From the introduction:

On a bounty board in some backwater town, there’s many faded parchments, but only one has the brand of the Lookouts. They’re monster hunters. Good ones. But they can’t be everywhere at once. So, you gonna take it? It pays... a little.

A 3-hour adventure for 3rd-4th level characters

201379.name: No Quarter (Issue 65 - Mar 2016)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

201380.name: No Quarter (Issue 66 - May 2016)
rpg: Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game

201381.description:
Expands the original game to allow 2-player game play.

Included in the deluxe version of the game. Available as a separate purchase for owners of the original version.

Description: This double-sided game board allows those who own versions of Brass previous to the Deluxe edition to play the 2-player variant.
201381.name: Brass 2-player board

201383.name: Mystery Solitaire
201383.description:
Mystery Solitaire integrates classic cases of murder and mayhem into a mix-and-match multi-deck twist on the classic game of Klondike/Patience. Take on the role of a sleuth and choose which case you will solve. Shuffle your deck of 52 cards together and you are ready to play!

Use the abilities on Sleuth cards to help with the investigation while negotiating the obstacles presented on Crime cards.

Win by playing all cards from your deck and tableau.

A single deck provides hours of single player enjoyment. However, multiple decks allow players to mix-and-match characters as well as unlocking the ability to play a two-player variant.

Will you alone find the clues?

201385.name: Moonshot: Lunar Solace
201385.description:
Reminiscent of childhood games, while maintaining a grown-up identity uniquely its own, MoonShot: Lunar Solace incorporates a space theme, unique binary dice mechanic, light strategic decision making, and the gotcha element to provide consistent levels of fun, anticipation, and excitement. The game may be equally enjoyed by casual gamers and strategists alike, and by youth as well as adults!

The year is 2142...Every year, on the anniversary of the settlement’s completion, each of the remaining factions sends a fleet of specially engineered jump ships, piloted by their most able-bodied and well respected personnel, to the annual MoonShot Race. The victorious faction earns the right to govern the planet until the next competition while the other competitors receive only lunar solace.

Each player will take the role of one of the competing factions, setting out into our debris speckled solar system in a race to be the first fleet back to the moon. The first player to advance their squadron of ships around the board and back to their finish area on the moon is the winner! Be careful though, because your opponents are looking to stop you, send you back home, and otherwise thwart your attempts to win; and with the help of the Solace Deck, they just might do that.

201386.name: The Coalition States: Heroes of Humanity
201386.description:
From ublisher blurb:

Rifts® Heroes of Humanity™ is the next chapter in the epic war for the soul of humanity.

A call to arms! The Minion War has spilled onto Rifts Earth. At the epicenter of the invasion is North America. If either of the two rival demonic forces succeeds in conquering the continent, the rest of the world shall follow and Earth will become an annex of Hell. The demon hordes believe no one can stop them. The Coalition States has something to say about that.

For the first time in history, the Coalition States, Northern Gun, the Manistique Imperium, Lazlo, New Lazlo, Free Quebec, the Cyber-Knights, Lemurians, True Atlanteans, D-Bees, mages, mercs and many, many others stand together against a common enemy. Meanwhile, the Splugorth of Atlantis, Archie Three, the Republicans and the Vanguard engage in their own shadow war against the invading demon hordes, and each other.

Heroes of Humanity™ lets unprecedented types of characters gather in mixed groups that would otherwise be ideologically opposed. Together they fight side-by-side for the greater good.
Ways to upgrade your existing characters.
Coalition Demon Hunter school and advanced training programs.
The strategies and tactics of the Minions of Hell against humanity.
The strategies and tactics of the Coalition States and its allies.
Summary of Demon and Deevil vulnerabilities.
How the Coalition is dealing with the Minion War.
Coalition military O.C.C.s expanded: CS Juicer, CS Combat Cyborgs, power armor pilots, Fly Boys, Military Specialists and more.
Coalition psychics and Psi-Battalion.
New CS gear and soldiers like the Hellbuster and Demonknights.
One Xiticix battle plan and who really pays the price.
Background on the CS, world information and many adventure ideas.
Plenty of guidelines, tables and rules to help you run it all.

201388.name: Divided Stand
201388.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Pathfinder compatible adventure for four to six level 4 heroes

Continuing on from False Honesty and Corrupt Virtue, the PCs find themselves in the middle of a heated election. It’s not only debates and scandals that plague the election campaign but threats from the past also threaten Rogail’s very existence. This is one deadly election campaign that Rogail will never forget.

In Divided Stand:

The conclusion for the Cloak and Ballot trilogy
Heated battles using Pathfinder’s mass combat rules
Numerous role-playing opportunities

201390.name: Feats of Cunning
201390.description:
From publisher blurb:

Feats of Cunning is the latest Mythic Mini devoted to exploring the subtle arts of intrigue, from spies and saboteurs to heists, chases, mysteries, secret identities, and the fine art of conversation. If your character survives more on brains than brawn, always being prepared for every eventuality and helping your allies to see the best path, he will love exploring the possibilities of 7 new mythic feats from Brilliant Planner and Sense Relationships to Insightful Advice and Omnipresent Mentor!

201391.name: Mazes & Perils Deluxe Edition
201391.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mazes & Perils Role-playing Game (MnP) takes a page from the first wave of the Old School Renaissance (OSR) when it wasn’t OLD at all… Inspired by the 1977 “Holmes” edition of the world’s most popular role-playing game, it shuns pages and pages of rules for a simpler time when House rules were the order of the day.

First released in 2012, MnP drew a line on the map of OSR retroclones as something easy to pick up and play where your heroes weren’t superheroes. There are no superpowers here. Fighters have swords and armor. Clerics have their faith. Thieves skulk in the shadows seeking better items to steal. And Magic-Users sling magics at their foes until they run out of spells. This style of gaming is about grit and wit – and if you die, it must be time to roll up a new character.

The original book was awarded a Gold Ennie Award in 2013 for "Best Free RPG" and now we've updated it with even more great content!

Now in 2016, Vince Florio and I have been working on a new version of MnP – with some new classes, new spells, new optional rules, and a new look! Mazes & Perils Deluxe offers everything you liked about the original with a new coat of paint and a few new tools in the toolbox! New bits include:

New Class – The Enchanter – along with 20+ new spells in his arsenal
New Class – The Shaman – along with nearly 20 new spells of his own
Rules for Variable Damage for Weapons and Variable Hit Dice
New layout, more art, and plenty of editing




Come check out a blast from the past and see why OSR is alive and well!

201392.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 329 - Jan 2003)
201392.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 329
January 2003

Electronic versions distributed as 21 separate files.

201393.description:
A two-sided playable promo item for Stronghold's Stellar Conflict. One side is a heavily-shielded Secret Base and the other side is an automated neutral pirate ship called the Chimera. Both feature variable scoring options and new possibilities for creative game play.

This promo was designed for the North American retail debut of Stellar Conflict at the Origins Game Fair convention in 2016.
201393.name: Stellar Conflict: Chimera / Secret Base

201394.name: Dragon Draft
201394.description:
Hunt the Dragon, Save the Realm!

Dragon Draft is a 4-player trick-taking card game where players pair up to earn the most Gems. Players earn Gems by drafting, playing special cards, and winning tricks.

Dragon Draft consists of rounds which are divided into 5 stages:
1. Deal
2. Draft
3. Reveal
4. Play
5. Score

After the final round each player counts their Gems. The team who has earned the most Gems is the Dragon Draft Champion and reigns victorious!

Contents:
50 Playing Cards
1 Dragon Card (#15)
4 King Cards (#14)
4 Queen Cards (#13)
4 Princess Cards (#12)
4 Jester Cards (#11)
4 Royal Guard Cards (#10)
4 Herald Cards (#9)
4 Advisor Cards (#8)
4 Merchant Cards (#7)
4 Dragon Tracker Cards (#6)
4 Dragon Tracker Cards (#5)
4 Gem Miner Cards (#4)
4 Frog Cards (#3)
1 Knight Card (#2)

201395.description:
Promo card given out during the Kickstarter for Garbage Day.

One player asks another player to marry them.

If they answer YES:
Share your room and your life with your fiance! Your room Max Size is now 20 and you now clean your room together.

If they answer NO:
Place this card into the Garbage Can.
201395.name: Garbage Day: "Will You Marry Me?" Promo

201396.description:
Get out of my room, NOW!

This expansion is all about sharing your love (or hate) with your annoying siblings. Tidy up that spare guest room because this expansion takes Garbage Day to 6 players.

Includes 15 new cards!
201396.name: Garbage Day: Family Expansion

201397.description:
Synergy! Delegate! Buzzwords!

This expansion is all about decreasing that workload so you can enjoy that nice corner office. Also, take on a new employee as this expansion takes "Garbage Day" up to 6 players.

Includes 15 new cards!
201397.name: Garbage Day: Office Expansion

201398.description:
Shhhhhh! Don't tell the RA!

This expansion packs your college dorm rooms so full you may want to sleep in the commons area. Clear off the top bunk as the expansion takes Garbage Day up to 6 players!

Includes 15 new cards!
201398.name: Garbage Day: Dorm Room Expansion

201399.name: Multicity
201399.description: In Multicity, up to four players are building one city. On your turn, you can chose between two options: Placing a city tile from the stack, or placing one of your personal tiles on board. Be the first to place all your people, houses, trees or cars in the right places to win the game.

201400.name: A Healer Only Lives Twice
201400.description:
User Summary

All You Need Is Heal! Monsters have cornered you in the dungeon corridors. As a newly hired Priest, your duties are to use your magical abilities to heal your comrade, a Knight on the front-line.

201406.name: OrganATTACK!
201406.description:
From the Kickstarter blurb:

The object of the game is to remove your opponents' organs using corresponding afflictions before they remove yours. The last person to still have at least one organ is the winner.

In addition to Affliction cards (like Pancreatitis, which can be played on either Gallbladder or Pancreas), the game has instant defensive cards, and lots of crazy tactical moves that shake things up. What you end up with is a pretty fast-paced, very fun, and often intense gameplay that's suitable for all levels of players.

201407.name: Invading Clans
201407.description:
From the back of the book:
Invaders from Beyond

they came from beyond the Periphery: invaders with advanced weapons, strange tactics and stranger customs. Arriving in 3049, they attacked world after world with unrelenting fury. By 3052 they had conquered more than 200 planets, and their target was clear. They sought to capture the cradle of humanity: Terra. If not for the battle of Tukayyid and the resulting truce, the Earth would surely have fallen.

We now know these invaders are the Clans, the sons and daughters of the legendary Aleksandr Kerensky, gone from known space for over 250 years. They seek to overthrow the Inner Sphere and recreate the lost Star League in the own image...or so it seems...

Invading Clans describes the history, culture and military capabilities of Clans Smoke Jaguar, Nova Cat, Ghost Bear, Steel Viper and Diamond Shark. Also included is an overview of occupied worlds, deadly new BattleMechs, and eight full-color pages featuring renderings of Clan uniforms and ceremonies.

201408.name: S.E.N.S
videogamehonor: 2016 Emotional Games Best Vr Game Winner
201408.description:
SENS is the first project to ever adapt a comic book into virtual reality.

A VR game inspired by a strange, awesome graphic novel: a maze without wall and only arrows to lead you through an outstanding journey.

Source: The Game Website.

201409.name: Mythic Wonders: The Philosopher's Stone
201409.description:
Emma wakes up from a scary dream: mysterious creature threatens her uncle Alfred. She feels that something bad just happened and it puzzles her…

Upon arrival she discovers that Alfred is missing and that the mythical portal, they were both working on, is active. What’s the story? Did her uncle enter the portal and embark on an adventure on his own?

Strange world on the other side of a mysterious artifact can be the answer, so the young woman dares to step into the unknown. An adventure in the worlds of five elements has just begun.

Emma will take on various mini games, puzzles and beautiful, hand drawn scenes with hidden objects to test her skills.

Source: [http://www.artifexmundi.com/page/mythic/# The Publisher Website].

201410.name: Luthien
201410.description:
From the back of the book:
Humiliated by their defeat on the planet Wolcott, the warriors of Clan Smoke Jaguar have returned to the Inner Sphere to avenge themselves against the armies of the Draconis Combine. Bolstered by Clan Nova Cat, the invaders have massed an invasion fleet of new omnimechs, battle-armored elementals and aerospace fighter to destroy the Dragon. Their Target? Luthien, the Black Pearl of the Combine, Capital of the Realm and home to the Imperial Palace.

Luthien lets you join the action as these fearsome invaders square off against the Combine's most elite mechwarriors and some of the Inner Sphere's finest mercenary units in an epic battle of the Clan Wars.

Luthien is a BattleTech scenario pack that includes a detailed history of the Battle of Luthien, personality profiles and MechWarrior statistics for major players in the engagement, game statistics for three new omnimech designs, and tow full-size battletech mapsheets of the Imperial City and the Kado-Guchi Valley

201411.name: Raiden V
201411.description:
User Summary

Raiden V is the latest entry in the Raiden series.

201412.description:
Src:Card 3-4 player expansion adds 60 additional cards to the game to allow 3-4 player play. The pack also contains extended instructions on how to play with additional players.

This is not a stand-alone product.
201412.name: Src:Card 3-4 Player Expansion

201413.name: Mioelnier (Nr. 1 - 1980)
201413.description:
No September 1 1980. A4. Contents include:

Chinese monk, Part 1 - a new AD & D class
Spökspalten
The three litters secret (AD & D adventure)
Reviews
Guild Voice

201414.name: Bass Fishing Board Game
201414.description:
The Bass Fishing Board Game involves moving around the board to different fishing spots with your boat pawn. At those spots you can use a combination of lures, action cards, and dice for the chance to land a big bass. The object of the game is to fill your boat with five of the largest fish. At the end of the tournament, each player's total fish weight is calculated and a winner is determined.

Visit www.bassfishingboardgame.com for more.

201415.name: The Black Moon Handbook
201415.description:
From the back of the book:

“Dear Reader, as you hold this book in your hands, wherever you may be in Tri-Kazel, know that you possess the summary of everything I have been able to learn about hauntings, ghosts, specters, and shadows...”

The Black Moon Handbook is a book written by occultist Steren Slaìne and annotated by alienist Enyl Mac Bedwyr. They have distinctly conflicting points of view on the nature of the strange phenomena that occur in Tri-Kazel. This confrontation offers arguments and methods of investigation, both to aficionados of the paranormal and to its detractors.

Although it is primarily intended for Game Leaders, this book can also be made directly part of the game by having the Characters find it and then allowing the Players to read it.

Contents include:

Haunting Phenomena in Tri-Kazel
A chapter introducing how hauntings manifest and how exorcisms can be carried out. It provides ingredients and advice to enrich and diversify eerie atmospheres, from mere oddities to spectacular supernatural manifestations.

Figures
A chapter detailing five Tri-Kazelian figures, each with a particular connection to occult phenomena: Steren Slaìne, the author of this book; Amy Dust Mèirleach, a Varigal who escaped the Ashen Yard; Brother Arathos, a former Sigire turned sorcerer; Keïr Mac Farquam, knight and last of a cursed line, and Yzvael Mac Baellec, an assassin wracked by madness.

Canvases
Four short scenarios complete with game aids offering unique plots woven around occult phenomena.

Bestiary
The book ends with the profiles of four creatures which are the objects of many legends and much speculation. Each one is connected to at least one of the Canvases or Figures.

201416.description: The Refuge: A Race for Survival is a post-apocalyptic zombie strategy game. The goal of the game is to be the first to reach the refuge while fending off zombies and other players. Each time you move, you activate a floor tile which have special features. The only tournament style zombie board game out there where you compete with six players in order to be the first one to reach the final refuge. Learning it takes less than five minutes, mastering it will take a while. Decisions make a big impact, and gameplay ranges heavily on the players skills: five minutes to one hour.
201416.name: The Refuge: A Race for Survival
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Dice Men Cometh – Episode 148
The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 66: Thursday, September 15th

201417.name: Tibetan Quest: Beyond the World's End
201417.description:
ibetan Quest: Beyond the Worlds End is a captivating hidden object game that blends together the elements of the thriller and adventure genres with oriental esotericism and lore.

When you were seeing off your beloved niece three weeks ago as she embarked on an archeological trip to Tibet, nothing could have foreshadowed the dramatic events that were about to unfold. Only yesterday you received a mysterious letter from which you learned that Larisa and her crew had gotten lost in a snow storm. Without hesitation you leave your family estate to come to your protégé’s rescue. The inhabitants of Lhasas Tibetan temple guide you toward the legendary city of Shangri-La where Larisa and her expedition were last seen. Discover what really happened in Shangri-La and what secrets are hidden in the labyrinth beneath this ancient city brimming with magic.

Beat the obstacles and puzzles, face the supernatural powers dwelling in the vast corridors, and find the clues about your nieces disappearance.

Will you find the courage to travel to mysterious Tibet? Will you face the dangers lurking in Shangri-La to save your family beyond the worlds end?

Source: The Publisher Website.

201418.name: Friday 13th: Jason in San Juan
201418.description:
Viernes 13: Jason en San Juan ("Friday The 13th: Jason in San Juan") Board game is a fan made tribute mostly to Viernes 13, a song made by urban songwriter and singer Vico-C and Friday The 13th franchise.
In this coop game the goal is get to Joseph Café before Jason does while every player is trying to survive every obstacle and stuff with Jason behind their backs!
Roll your dice, run for your life and try not to fall into Jason's Hideouts or hesitate on a Event because even when you are next to Joseph Café, Jason can get you!

201420.name: Pax Renaissance Expansion
201420.description: The Pax Renaissance Expansion introduces 59 new cards with new abilities to Pax Renaissance, new "Renaissance Man" card types, and two new one-shots: Apostasy & Victory Inactivation.

201421.name: Going to Market
201421.description:
This children's game from Corey Games is a very simple roll and move race. Players each get two tokens and must move them along a path that includes four circles and rectangle. They must spin the exact number needed to reach the exit (red dot) square of each of these.

The only element of judgment is over which token to move with a given spin so as to make it through the exit points. Movement is eased by a "move ahead seven" space in each circle that just happens to put a token on the exit dot.

201422.name: Clown Capers
201422.description:
This children's game combines a deck of 54 small cards and a playing board. The board has outlines of four large clown faces, each containing 12 spaces for cards. There also are six green spaces for individual cards. Each of the cards has a number and either a piece of clown face or an animal.

Players are dealt eight cards each, with the remainder forming a draw pile. In turn each must try to play a card on one of the spaces. The first player must play either a 1 card on one of the clown noses or an animal card on a green space. If he can do neither, he draws a card.

Each clown face must be built up in number order, from 1 (nose) to 2 (eyes), 3 (mouth) 4 (eyebrows), 5-6 (ears) and finally 7 (hair). There are two spaces for eyebrows, eyes, mouth, and upper and lower ears, and the right and left numbered spaces must have precisely matching parts on each face.

Each player either plays a card or draws until one player managers to win by being the first to empty his hand. The rules recommend continuing the game until all the clown faces are filled out.

201423.name: BattleStick
201423.description:
BattleStick is a stickmen MMO where you fight in an arena with other players in an arena with several weapons to gain power and mislead your enemy by feigning death.

Source: The Game Website.

201424.name: Dungeon of Zolthan
201424.description:
User Summary

Your goal is to defeat Zolthan; a powerful mage that lives inside the dungeon.

201425.name: Murasaki
201425.description:
"Murasaki" is a puzzle explosion game. Use explosions to clear the screen of pesky obstacles filling it up. The only controls you need are the directional buttons and two other buttons (Z and X)!

Source: The Game Website.

201426.name: Sins Of The Demon
201426.description:
User Summary

Follow the journey of Kenshi, a wandering demon hunter, and his brother, a demon cat seeking a way to return to his true form.

201427.name: Crush Crush
201427.description:
ey hot stuff! Are you looking for a fun and flirty game to kill some time and make you laugh out loud? That’s a crazy coincidence, because it’s been looking for you! Welcome to Crush Crush – the Idle Dating Sim!

Source: The Developer Website.

201428.name: Moonstone Tavern
201428.description:
User Summary

With the death of your aunt you have been left the once famous Moonstone Tavern. Unfortunately the tavern has seen better days.

201429.name: Northwind Highlanders
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
201429.description:
From back of book:

A history of honor, a future of glory

Since the distant time when mankind knew only one sky and one sun, soldiers of the proud units that became the Northwind Highlanders have won brilliant victories against often-desperate odds. From small-scale uprisings in ancient Scotland to epic struggles between mighty star empires over countless worlds, the Northwind Highlanders of every generation have added to their forebears battlefield glory. Fiercely proud warriors, the Highlanders have left their legendary mark on the universe - and will do so as long as war rages in the Inner Sphere.

The Northwind Highlanders is a Battletech scenario pack that follows the career of this phenomenal unit, from its inception on Earth in the 18th century to the latest battles of the 31st century. Fourteen scenarios drawn from different periods in the Highlanders' distinguished history let players recreate the unit's greatest battles - beginning with the First Kearny Highlanders' near-fatal first engagement in 2366, all the way to the year 3059. Also included are a detailed unit history and a complete military roster. Players can use optional rules that reflect the specialties of each Highlander regiment in conjunction with the Battletech: Field Manuals series to create their own Northwind Highlander scenarios.

201430.name: Shaolin vs Wutang
201430.description:
User Summary

Features include hand to hand and weapon combat, and licensed music.

201431.name: Madness Cubed
201431.description:
User Summary

Fight with other players, or team up with them to defeat hordes of zombies and mutants!

201432.name: FleetCOMM
201432.description:
User Summary

FLEETCOMM is a tactical squadron combat game.

201433.name: Rogue Port: Red Nightmare
201433.description:
User Summary

Help reunite your missing friends and save your family from wild animals.

201434.name: Impossible Geometry
201434.description:
Impossible Geometry is challenging platformer inspired by 2 amazing games! We have tried hard to take best of two worlds and bring you impossible challenges. You have deserved them!

Source: The Developer Website.

201435.name: OddPlanet
201435.description:
User Summary

OddPlanet is a side-scrolling adventure game.

201436.name: Dungeon Rushers
201436.description:
A Heroic-Parody tactical RPG combining dungeon crawler’s gameplay and turn-based fights. Dive in an off-beat universe, manage your team and craft mighty gear to equip them! Build your own dungeon by hiding traps and monsters in your galleries, then challenge other players to clean it!

Source: The Game Website.

201437.name: Assassins vs Pirates
201437.description:
Swordplay and freerun through the internet and on a couch against your friends in a team brawl. Throw bombs, use smokescreens and climb your way to the enemy base. Choose your side as a Pirate or an Assassin and feed the Artifact with souls of your enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

201438.name: RefRain - prism memories -
201438.description:
RefRain - prism memories - is an empowering, cyberpunk, bullet-hell shoot-’em-up that focuses on fast-paced, offensive gameplay. “Dive” into a hazardous digital world, cycle through 3 different attack modes, and delete the opposition with superior firepower.

Source: The Developer Website.

201439.name: Cubikolor
201439.description:
Armed only with your logic and your Kube, move through the 150 levels outwitting the traps in the System, an evil, scheming entity, to confront the machine and pass the test!

Source: The Game Website.

201440.description:
Based on his abstract L-Game, this is a themed election simulation game by the same designer, Edward de Bono, using a British general election as a model.

While the original L-Game can be played with the pieces and board which are the same dimensions as the original, this game adds descriptions and effects to the 16 board spaces which influence the standing of political parties on an included "Poll Indicator" chart.

At the end of each player's move, the uncovered spaces on the board influence the standings of the two Main Parties (players) and the non-player Other Parties. For example, if the "Diplomatic or military success" space is left uncovered then the government party gains 1% in the polls at the end of their move, while the the opposition party would lose 1%.

Unlike the original L-Game, this version does not end if a player is unable to make a move. Instead the game ends after a time limit, fixed number of turns or if the "Snap election" space is left uncovered the active player chooses to end the game. At this point the support for the non-player Other Parties is subtracted from that of the leading Main Party to determine the winner.
201440.name: Election L-Game

201441.name: Digger Dan DX
201441.description:
Can you guide him in the right direction by digging through the earth to collect the gems and nuggets of gold? Work out your path carefully as you push rocks out of the way or you could find Dan caught in one of the many traps.

Source: The Publisher Website.

201442.name: Sweetest Thing
201442.description:
Ants have invaded Candy Land. The town square's chocolate fountain has run dry and gingerbread houses are starting to crumble. It’s time to call in a sugar repair engineer! Travel to Cupcake State, Chocolate Shire and Jelly City to rebuild a candy realm. Gather, fix and build. Isn't it sweet?

Source: The Publisher Website.

201443.name: Super Night Riders
201443.description:
A modern arcade racing game inspired by the retro classics.

Source: The Publisher Website.

201444.description:
Saboteur: Playmat features a 5*11 grid for tunnel cards.

As the half-open rectangles at the edge of the mat indicate, this grid does not limit the placement of cards (though anyone digging way out of the grid should be considered suspicious)
201444.name: Saboteur: Playmat

201446.name: Shifting Realms
201446.description:
Shifting Realms is a game of colliding worlds. Five worlds are included — Alfheim, Tyrfing, Dovre, Libertatia and Anunna — each unique in board layout, structures, story cards, tasks, and end conditions. To set up the game, three worlds are selected at random, then players take actions until two out of the three worlds' end conditions are met, at which point the game ends.

During the game, players send out peasants to collect resources, recruit soldiers to protect their peasants, build structures to gain powers, and earn victory points. Story cards and individual tasks add intrigue and complexity to gameplay.

201447.name: The Next Door
201447.description:
User Summary

Without many clues, you go from a surreal insemination to a moon landing, only to end up in an apartment trying to figure out the clues on the floor and the ceiling to go from there. The graphics are basic and the music suitable for its artistic puzzle quality. Multiple endings are available in tune with its illuminati aspects.

201448.name: Planetary Annihilation: Titans
201448.description:
A standalone expansion to Planetary Annihilation.

The galactic war between ancient robot factions kicks into high gear with 21 new game-changing combat units, including five IMMENSE Titan-class units! Conquer new worlds and craft new strategies to take advantage of all-new multi-level terrains! Lead thousands of units in interplanetary campaigns across land, sea, air, and space! Destroy entire planets in your quest to dominate the galaxy!

Source: The Developer Website.

201449.name: Steredenn
201449.description:
STEREDENN is a frenetic and chaotic space shooter, carved in big beautiful pixels with insane boss battles. Embark in your ship and engage the fight against dreadful space pirates in a never-ending combat for your survival. The game is fast, addictive, hard and action-packed.

Source: The Developer Website.

201451.name: El Favor del Faraón: Momia
201451.description:
Promotional tile from the Spanish edition

Roll 1 die (specials included) and 1 instant die.

Remove 1 scarab to each player

201452.name: BANDITS!
201452.description:
User summary
In the game of BANDITS!, players are bosses of bandit bands, and try to steal unearthed treasures. The player with the most treasures wins the game.

Each round, a treasure is unearthed from each of four sites. Treasure value ranges from 1 to 10. Then each player plays a thief and reveals them simultaneously.

A thief card has a specific color that indicates which site to go to. If you go into a site alone, you steal all the treasures there.

If two or more players chose the same site, they can negotiate to split the treasures there, or fight to grab all the treasures. Treasures not taken are held over to next round, heating up the game. Players hire thieves using treasures they have stolen.

The base set has special cards: Knights and Golems. And there is an expansion that has Dragons, Princesses, and Witches, adding more excitement to the game.

Publisher's summary
プレイヤーは盗賊団の親分です。プレイヤーが雇っている盗賊で発掘された宝を盗みます。
盗賊団を強くするために盗んだ宝で盗賊を雇います。
勝利者はゲーム終了時に宝を多く持っていたプレイヤーです。
発掘場所では毎ターン１つずつ宝が発掘されます。その価値は１〜１０点のランダムです。
宝を見た各プレイヤーは盗賊を1人選び、同時に公開します。
発掘場所と盗賊はそれぞれ4色あります。盗賊は自分と同じ色の発掘場所の宝を盗みに入ることが出来ます。
同じ発掘場所に盗賊が集まった場合、交渉によって宝を分配する事が出来ます。
もしくは、戦争して勝つ事で、全ての宝を入手出来ます。
発掘場所に残された宝はキャリーオーバーします。ゲームはヒートアップします。
基本セットには騎士、ゴーレムが含まれます。さらに、拡張セットもあります。ドラゴン、姫、魔女、が登場し更にゲームが盛り上がります！

201453.name: Hip Hops
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Polyhedron Collider Cast - UK Games Expo 2016
201453.description:
From the publisher:

Hip Hops is the collectible beer card game that is fast and easy to learn. Simply use the different attributes of beer on each card - alcohol content, bitterness, year of introduction, hops - to beat your opponents in this strategic, fun and original new game. Designed for 2-6 players, each game takes 15-25 minutes.

The cards are designed in London and beautifully printed by the world's finest collectible card game manufacturers in Belgium. The first deck, Brews of the World, features 44 beers from around the world, including AleSmith, Beavertown, BrewDog, Evil Twin, Founders, Mikkeller, Nøgne Ø, Thornbridge, To Øl and many more. You decide which beers get in the next pack.

In the boosters there is over 200 additional cards too collect.

201454.name: Age of Barbarian Extended Cut
201454.description:
Age of Barbarian Ex is an action hack 'n 'slash game inspired to 80s, fantasy and sword-and-sorcery genre. Muscular barbarians, succinct girls, hordes of bloodthirsty monsters, a lot of gore, a pretty epic story and an addictive soundtrack! What's best in life?

Source: The Developer Website.

201455.description:
Description from the publisher:

Based on the story first presented in the Storm King’s Thunder adventure from Dungeons & Dragons, Assault of the Giants is a new board game designed by Andrew Parks for 3-6 players. Players will need to command armies of giants as they wage war throughout northwest Faerûn. Order your giants to assault small folk villages and cities to score points and secure resources including food, artifacts, ore, and runes.

Each player issues commands to his or her giants in the form of command cards (recruit, move, attack, pillage, and so on). This allows players to recruit new giants, send them out to attack settlements and other giants, and also to pursue special agendas based upon their race. Each player represents a different giant race (hill giants, stone giants, frost giants, fire giants, cloud giants, or storm giants), each with a different agenda. For example, the Storm Giants seek to restore their lost monarch, King Hekaton. The Cloud Giants seek an ancient dragon treasure trove, and the Hill Giants seek an abundance of food with which to feed their massive monarch, Chief Guh.

Contents include 12 Giants miniatures, injection molded in color, measuring from approximately 60mm to over 90mm in height, and three Giantslayers.

Preliminary FAQ: https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1730050/assault-giants-prel...
201455.name: Assault of the Giants
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 36 - Kingmaking: Real or Imagined Problem?
RDTN Episode 116: Assault of the Giants, Jump Drive, Moons and Chit Chat
SC 002 Interview: Dungeon Alliance with Andrew Parks

201456.name: Hero Lab
201456.description:
This game requires good skills!

Every player in his turn play as a mad scientist who'll try to create some heroes by a mix of potions while the other players will try to steal them creating the best super heroes team.

The Scientest player is the master who has got in his hand some cards to mix in groups of three cards matching with the three components useful to realize every Super Hero.

Some component cards are covered and other ones are discovered, so everybody can use the discovered informations to understand if the superhero has been created or not.

The Master must realize more super hero as possible for receiving award to delete his malus at the end of the game.

Every other player must block (with the hand), before the other players, the super heroes realized, receiving victory points.

If you block a not realized super hero you'll receive the same points as malus.

The winner is the player with more victory points at the end of the game.

201457.name: Hyakumannin Shinda Busho
201457.description:
User summary
100万人死んだ部署 (Hyakumannin Shinda Busho) in English would be "The Department That Claimed a Million Lives". (In Japan, there is a picture book named "Hyakumankai Ikita Neko" (The Cat That Lived a Million Times), and the game title is derived from that).

Welcome to the department that claimed a million lives!

You are assigned to a department that is said to have killed a million workers, and have four job cards to work on.

You cannot finish your jobs without the part-time worker Miya-chan's help, so everyone competes to get her. When a player finishes all their jobs, her working time runs out and everyone else has to work over-time to finish their remaining jobs by themselves. Add up the face values of cards in their hand, and that's the over-time hours this week.

If a player's total over-time exceeds 300 hours, that player suffers Karoshi (death from overwork) and loses the game. All other players win because the department gets investigated and all survivors are liberated from overworking.

If all players survive four weeks without exceeding 300 hours, all players win the game.

There are four types of cards in the game.
(1) paperwork: Playable while you have control of Miya-chan to finish a job
(2) snack: Playable in response to paperwork to gain control of Miya-chan
(3) toy: Playable while you have control of Miya-chan to make others discard snacks
(4) paperwork with candy: Playable while a toy is active to gain control of Miya-chan

Use them wisely and finish all jobs with Miya-chan.

Publisher's summary
100万人死んだ部署へようこそ！
あなたたち社員（プレイヤー）は『100万人死んだ部署』と呼ばれる部署に配属され、仕事（4枚の手札）を渡されることになります。
手札は、アルバイトの『ミヤちゃん』に手伝ってもらうことで減らすことができます。
社員同士で「ミヤちゃんに手伝ってもらう権利」を奪い合い、誰よりも早く自分の仕事（手札）をゼロにしましょう！
手札が残ってしまった人は、カードの数字を合計して「残業時間」として記録していきます。
勝利条件は2つあり、①誰かの残業時間が累計300時間を超えて『過労死（負け）』した際に生きていること、　または　②全員で4週間生き残ること、です。
ゲームのフェイズは4段階あり、それぞれ「準備」「スタートプレイヤーの決定」「権利を奪い合うメインのゲーム」「残業時間の計算と勝利判定」になります。
この準備～勝利判定までの流れを1週間と呼び、誰も死んでいなければ手札を配りなおして再開します（1週間を終えるのには3分もかかりません！）。
メインのゲームでは、権利を持っているプレイヤーが手札から場にカードをプレイしていきます。カードに描かれた4種類の絵柄で権利を奪い合います。
権利を持っているときにプレイできる書類、書類が出た時に出せて権利を奪える「おやつ」、権利を持つときに他全プレイヤーのおやつを捨てさせる「おもちゃ」、おもちゃが出た時におやつの代わりに出せて権利をうばえる「おまけつき書類」の4種類があります。

201458.description:
A card game dedicated to all the bands who haven't made it (yet)

Band Manager: Backstage Clash is a love letter to the music industry: players feel the pressure of becoming more mainstream to survive, and must navigate the uneasy balance between companionship and headcount in a touring band.

Starting with nothing but pure passion, players go on tours to win career opportunities and fans. However, tours are expensive and risky. The risk may be mitigated by cooperating with others, but then players must split the spoils, so band members must earn their place or be left out.

Early in players’ career, tours are niche; poorly promoted with obscure genres & unusual instruments (bagpipe reggae?). As the game progresses, players gain success by selling out to more mainstream music and learning how to do effective marketing. As their careers take off, the incentive to cooperate with other players fades away, leaving nothing but a desperate race for fans.
201458.name: Band Manager: Backstage Clash
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 026 – Random Top 10 Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 029 – Why Jam Improves Your Game
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 030a – New Releases, News, Kickstarters

201459.name: The Shrine of Marthammor Duin
201459.description:
Princes of the Apocalypse Supplement

From the introduction:

Nearly 4000 years ago when the dwarf kingdom of Besilmer stretched clear across the Dessarin Valley the hill dwarves erected wayfarer shrines to their god of wanderers, Marthammor Duin.
Now, as Elemental Evil continues to attract monstrous beings to the ruins of Tyar-Besil, some opportunistic lesser demons have crept through the lower planes to corrupt these shrines.

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters. The module is provided in standard and printer-friendly format, varying only in the lack of a page background. Two PNG files also are distributed with the module - a full size dungeon map, and a "journal fragment" handout for pint-and-play use.

201461.name: Technical Readout: 3025
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
201461.description:
From back of book:
This Technical Readout lists the capabilities and history of the most common pieces of military hardware used by the major houses of the Successor States in the year 3025. Focusing on Battlemechs and Aerospace Fighters, this volume also discusses important combat and support vehicles as well as the rare Land-Air-Mechs. In all 55 'Mechs, 15 fighters, 3 LAMS, 4 DropShips, and 12 vehicles are described and illustrated, making this volumen a must for all, from historians to MechWarriors.

201462.name: Where's My Helmet?
201462.description:
https://www.facebook.com/wheresmyhelmet/

A challenging platform style game combined with aesthetic elements of the Nordic culture and doses of humor are the charming elements that make "Where's my Helmet?" a must-have title in the Steam library of all gamers.

201463.name: Venture City
rpgseries: A World of Adventure for Fate Core System
201463.description:
User Summary: Massively expanded and developed reworking of Venture City Stories.

Publisher Blurb: Take a trip to Venture City, a world of superpowers, villainous corporations, and ruthless gangs, set in a near-future where powers are for sale. From the corporate sponsored heroes to the supervillains in the news, and all the way down to the little guys who try to hide their powers, there are superheroes everywhere you see. Bring them to your Fate Core table with this Venture City compilation, which includes both Venture City Stories and Venture City Powers, written by masterminds Brian Engard and Ed Turner.

201464.name: Technical Readout: 3057 Dropships, Jumpships & Warships
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
201464.description:
From back of book:
In 3049, the first clan forces appeared in the Inner Sphere. Armed with advanced technologies of a long-dead age, the warlike invaders unleashed a devastating blitzkrieg, capturing world after world until a total Clan victory seemed certain. Unable to match the enemy's superior 'Mechs, the Inner Sphere militaries increasingly turned to the combat fleets for relief, only to find the skies filled with deadly Clan Dropship, Jumpships and Warships - massive vessels not seen in the Inner Sphere for hundreds of years. Now the Great Houses have begun to rebuild their own armadas and stand ready to challenge the Clan invaders in the infinite battlefield of space.

The BattleTech Technical Readout: 3057 contains descriptions, illustrations, and full BattleSpace statistics for the latest Inner Sphere and Clan Dropships, Jumpships Warships, small craft, aerospace fighters, Omnifighters and conventional aircraft. BattleSpace rules clarifications and record sheets are also included.

201465.name: Bubblegumshoe
201465.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Someone stole my kid brother’s bike…

Someone sabotaged the pep rally…

Someone destroyed the Homecoming queen’s reputation…

The world is full of mysteries. It’s up to your group of intrepid teen sleuths to solve them. In Bubblegumshoe, players step into the shoes of high-schoolers solving mysteries in a modern American small town. Discover clues, solve problems, and throw down with enemies in this streamlined RPG based on the GUMSHOE system.
In this stand-alone game, you’ll find:

Rules to create your Sleuth’s web of relationships and make the most of GUMSHOE’s resource-management
A simple setting system designed for large scale town creation all the way down to scene locations, plus extensive information on Drewsbury, a ready-to-go setting
A variety of short mystery starters, including a full introductory mystery: Hey! That’s My Bike!
Extensive support to help GMs create their own mysteries using pre-established characters and settings
Rules for social Throwdowns as well as physical altercations to reflect the drama of high school noir
A slimmed-down list of investigative abilities vs GUMSHOE’s default to make for faster decision making

201466.name: Fear Itself (2nd Edition)
201466.description:
Publisher Blurb:
Fear Itself plunges ordinary people into a disturbing contemporary world of madness and violence. Players take the roles of regular folks much like themselves, who are inexorably drawn into confrontation with the creatures of the Outer Dark, an unearthly realm of alien menace. With or without its distinctive mythology, GMs can use it to replicate the shudders and shocks of the horror genre in both film and literature.
Fear Itself serves as an ideal platform for one-shot games, in which, like any self-respecting horror flick, few, if any, of the protagonists are expected to survive the climax. It can also be employed to run ongoing campaigns in which the leading characters gradually discover more about the disturbing supernatural reality hiding in the shadows of the ordinary world. Over time, they grow more adept at combating them—or spiral tragically into insanity and death.
This expanded edition explains how to adjust both the game rules and the assumptions of Gamemasters and players to different styles of game, from bloody one-shots to extended investigative games. Revised rules update Fear Itself with ten years of GUMSHOE development and play experience.
Included are three sample scenarios:
The Circle: in this one-shot, the players take on the roles of participants in an experimental drug trial. When one of their group disappears, they must investigate what happened to him – before the same horrific fate consumes them, too!
The Ocean Game: Play the Ocean Game, and find meaning in your life. Play the Ocean Game, and win eternity. Play the Ocean Game, and drown in it. In this miniseries, the players participate in a cryptic contest run by a Mystery Man. The prize is glorious. The cost is more than sanity can bear.
The Dispatchers: No backup. No assistance. Just a voice on the radio in the night, asking you for help. In this campaign, the player are cast as unlikely monster hunters, drawn together by a mysterious radio signal. Can they survive their missions long enough to save themselves?

201467.name: Delving!
201467.description:
Delving! is a fantasy themed family card game for two to five players. Play time is about 20 minutes.

Take on the role of both dungeon crafter and seasoned adventurer. Explore the dungeon, slay the monsters, grab the treasure all while trying to thwart the efforts of your rivals.

Play is divided into three rounds called crawls. For each crawl a new dungeon is created from the encounter deck. Each crawl starts with a line of eight cards. Players take turns playing adventure cards from their hand affecting the dungeon as well as their opponents’ hands and loot piles.

The winner is the player who has scored the most points at the end of the final crawl. Scoring is done by totaling the victory value of the cards in each player's score pile, the number on the bottom left of the encounter or adventure card.

Each turn players do the following.

1) Play an adventure card (optional)

Adventure cards allow you to move encounters forward or backward in line, draw extra cards, add or remove encounters from the line, affect your opponents score pile, move your hero to the other end of the line, and more.

2) Attempt an encounter

You will automatically defeat the encounter at the front of the line provided there is no challenge number on that card. Otherwise you must meet or beat that number on a d6 to defeat it.

3) Draw an adventure card

The next player to the left then takes a turn, and so on.

Play continues with each player taking their turn until no more cards are left in the dungeon. That crawl is then over and a new crawl begins.

201469.name: Last One Standing (Free Version)
201469.description:
From the introduction:

In the near future, the world has gotten worse. Groups of kids, sometimes from the same town or school and sometimes from all over the nation, are kidnapped and put into grand arenas and forced to fight to the death on national TV. Some say it’s solely for entertainment, some say it’s to send a message, and others have even wilder theories. One thing’s for sure – only the last one standing makes it out alive. The players play as these young people in their struggle for survival against overwhelming odds. Some may try to escape, others will embrace the battle, but ultimately what happens is up to them.

User summary:

The free version of the game is distributed as a ZIP archive including the HTML game document and several supporting PDF files, including:

- Basic Moves (rules)
- GM Moves (rules)
- Blank Sheets (print-and-play components)
- Contestant Set One (pre-generated characters)
- The Volcanic Island (setting; combat arena)
- Stern Researcher (sample character)

201470.name: Curse of Syllani
201470.description:
From the introduction:

It started with a wealthy and powerful family who settled in these uninhabited lands, on the far outskirts of the Sword Coast. There were two brothers, sons of the settlers. One was Dervak, and the younger brother Grohm. Both sought the affections of a beautiful farm girl named Syllani, who grew up with the brothers.

User summary:

For 1st - 4th level characters

201471.name: Questions Without Answers
201471.description:
Publisher blurb:

In a world where most people still dismiss genre fiction as 'trash' or 'pulp', it should be no surprise that role playing games don’t have a reputation for literary value. And, to be fair, I can understand why: most adventures are just for fun, and are not intended to be particularly literary.

On the other hand, though, neither are most novels written to be literary, and I don’t see anyone pointing at Twilight and saying, "See? If that’s a book, books can’t possibly be literature!"

While not all games should be literary, the stories we tell with them can be literary experiences. And one thing that separates literature from 'trash' (even fun, satisfying trash), at least for me, is the asking of a grand question.

So, drawing on more than two decades of combined gaming and teaching experience, I offer a list of 50 Questions Without Answers, and brief advice on using them in three ways: As a player running a character with a grand question, as a Game Master planning a story with literary drive, and as a game designer who wants to support this kind of play.

201472.name: Mind Blast!
201472.description:
From the introduction:

At the roof of the world, an ancient order watches over a vault of enchanted memories. When raiders attack their sanctuary, an unexpected explosion sends the vault spiraling into meltdown. It's up to the heroes to save the memories… if they can keep their heads!

User summary:

For 4th level characters

201473.name: The Halfling Horde
201473.description:
From the introduction:

Five years ago, the newly-minted Baron Eligost was granted a parcel of land in the great plains on the frontier of his liege’s kingdom. On the advice of his mentor, the wizard Oxidus, Eligost led a small band of pioneers into the valley and founded the farming village of Round River on the banks of the River Gren. The good breadth and depth and meandering pace of the Gren permitted easy trade with the cities and towns downstream and Round River prospered, quickly doubling and tripling in size.

Last month, however, just before the winter solstice, a halfling outrider dressed in rough hides and furs rode his pony into the Round River town square and announced that the Broadbelt Horde was returning to winter in its most sacred valley, and that Round River must be abandoned or face complete destruction.

User summary:

For 7th - 9th level characters

201474.name: No Quarter
201474.description:
From the introduction:

The ancient city of Stormhold has been under siege for nearly 6 months by a vicious horde of orcs, goblins, ogres and other demi-­‐humans calling themselves the Legion of Koranth. Whatever power has bound these wretched creatures together has set its gaze on the lonely city, located high in the Shivering Peaks. In the city’s nearly 8000 year history, it has been besieged, sacked, razed and conquered again and again, but it has also cast down countless would be conquerors too.

User summary:

For 4th - 5th level characters

201475.name: The Dreaming Heralds
201475.description:
From the introduction:

Whilst travelling down a lonely stretch of highway called the Baron’s Road, the characters meet Abel Yarl, a farmer. He pleads with them to help him find out what has happened to his son, Devek, who has fallen into a death-like slumber. After some investigation at the Yarl farm, the characters proceed into the woods to find a mysterious temple of Ra. Once there, they will need to brave the traps and defences of the temple to find an antidote that can save Devek.

User summary:

For 1st level characters

201476.name: The Grand Illusionist's Delusion
201476.description:
From the introduction:

The Tome of Absence is a powerful spellbook of illusion magic. Many of the greatest illusionists throughout history possessed the tome, but most hid it someplace secret, died at the hands of a rival magician, or simply disappeared. The tome has a dark secret: it feeds on the spirit of its owner, using the magician’s own life to fuel his or her illusions, eventually killing its master and trapping his or her soul.

The Tome's previous owner, Albrecht Sparrowing, once lived in a mansion outside Dinton, but he disappeared thirty-five years ago. Looters have explored the mansion, but none have returned. For many years the mansion sat, dilapidated and ignored. Recently, the townsfolk of Dinton have noticed lights coming from the mansion and the worn-down exterior was restored to its former grandeur, seemingly overnight.

User summary:

For 5th - 8th level characters

201477.name: The Vile Secret of VonGlauss Mansion
201477.description:
From the introduction:

The [characters] have recently killed a powerful yet somewhat crazed vampire by the name of Victor VonGlauss.
...
Upon his demise, [the characters] find three items of interest: a locket around his neck that has the pictures of a beautiful human woman on one half and a female human baby on the other; a map containing the area that the players are currently in; and a thick iron key.

User summary:

For 5th - 7th level characters

201478.description:
From the publisher:

It's a perfect day for a picnic! The park fills with families, spreading their blankets, and setting out colourful plates loaded with delicious treats.

But there has never been a picnic without uninvited guests ... ANTS!!

In Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants, players are competing ant colonies trying to steal the best plates of food from the picnic blankets. In this 2-4 player, dice-rolling dexterity game, the dice are your ants. Roll them onto the picnic cards, trying to get the most ants onto the best foods. Different custom dice at your disposal represent your industrious Workers, speedy Scouts, and sturdy Soldiers. At the end of the day, the colony that has arranged their stolen plates to best satisfy the whims of the Queen will earn the most points and win the game.
201478.name: Problem Picnic: Attack of the Ants
boardgamefamily: Games by the Game Artisans of Canada
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 70: Thursday, September 29th
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 99

201481.name: Blue Max
201481.description:
Blue Max is a multi-player wargame of World War I aerial combat over the Western Front during 1917 and 1918. Each player is a fighter pilot of the British, French, American, or German air service. Each game is a single dogfight, in which players try to shoot down as many enemy planes as possible without being shot down themselves.

Source: The Game Website.

201482.description:
Search and Survive is a cooperative, zombie apocalypse deck building game for 1-4 players. In Search and Survive players must work together to rescue survivors, gather resources, and complete objectives; all while attempting to keep the growing zombie threat in check. The zombies have unique abilities to challenge players with, and the Horde moves towards the players with the potential of moving off of the play area and damaging them.

Unlike many games within the deck building genre, Search and Survive offers a unique combat system that blends card values with dice rolls. Failed attacks, zombie advancement, and zombie abilities can all cause players to take Damage cards. These cards not only dilute a player's deck, but are also a finite resource. If any one player takes their 10th Damage Card the game ends in defeat.

In Search and Survive players must decide how far they want to push their luck on their turns. As ammunition depletes attacks become more dangerous. Melee attacks must also be considered carefully as close combat is riskier than ranged, but also has some powerful rewards. As combat resolves players take the spoils of war and add them to their decks, increasing their strength.

Players must work together to complete the objective of the session. Rescued survivors, locations, useful items, and powerful weapons must be combined to ensure the survival of the human race.
201482.name: Search and Survive
boardgamepodcastepisode: The First Roll - What's New on Kickstarter? - Episode 66: Thursday, September 15th

201483.name: Mechwarrior Personnel File: Kurita
rpg: A Time of War: The BattleTech RPG
201483.description:
From back of Folio:
KEEP YOUR RECORDS STRAIGHT!

The MechWarrior Personnel File provides you with Battletech military data documents and serves as a storage folder for all your BattleTech papers. There are five different files - one for each of the five houses. Each file is printed in the appropriate House colors and contains components unique to that House. Plus your file can be personalized by you to fit your (or your characer's) individual background.

Here's what you get:

Colorful Storage Folder
Officer's Commission
House Recruiting Poster
'Mech Pilot Certificate
Letter from your House Leader
MechWarrior Service Record
After-action reports
Kill Stickers
Next of kin/Insurance Form
Radiation Detection Badge

201484.name: The Red Door
201484.description:
User Summary

Mythology-based text adventure written by Tom Frost.

201485.description:
From back of Book:
These new record sheets feature:

The NEW control table on the back of each vehicle sheet! The new chart is the most up-to-date available, and conforms to the Car Wars Compendium, Second Edition
The appropriate Crash Table for the vehicle on the back of each record sheet!
The NEW five-phase movement chart is featured on the back cover for easy use!




These vehicle design sheets are sold for the convenience of the Car Wars players who don't have easy access to a photocopier. Permission is granted to the purchaser of any Car Wars product to copy all charts, tables and record sheets - including these! - for personal use.
201485.name: Car Wars Vehicle Design Sheets

201486.description:
Spiral consists of two games:

The Gift: A two-player abstract strategy game with a dose of luck; cards contained in a trick determine where you must play. It's a a mashup of David Parlett's Tantony and Cameron Browne's Cross with a unique way of ensuring that you don't know precisely the contents of your opponent's hand.

Grazing: A solitaire game played with a formidable virtual opponent. It's a mashup of the objectives of Jorge Gomez Arrausi's Unlur with a simple solitaire game. You are trying to win a game against a virtual opponent that plays two pieces per turn.
201486.name: Spiral

201487.name: Battle of Midway, June 1942: Minigame
201487.description:
From the designer:

This is an even simpler, air group version (for me and my 8 year old son to play) of my squadron level 1990 game Deadly Reckoning, which I am in the process of revising/updating. It nonetheless seems to have all the essential elements and decision points of a depthy Midway game.

90 miles per hex, 3 hour turns, 13 Japanese combat units, 11 American. All icons crafted pixel by pixel by me.

201488.name: GiAnt
201488.description:
What is one small step for a human, is one GiAnt adventure for an Ant.... Join Adam in this fun filled first-person platformer from the indie solo developer at 'Wreck Tangle Games'. Roam vast human sized worlds as a tiny little ant, but this is no Ant Simulator! This is an AntVenture!

Source: The Developer Website.

201489.name: Systematic Immunity
201489.description:
Systematic Immunity is a challenging precision platformer set inside the human body...and not a particularly healthy one either. This body has been infected by a big, nasty bugger of a germ, who is making it his business to spawn many more germs as fast as he can.

Source: The Game Website.

201490.name: Just a Cleric
201490.description:
Become the titular wussy cleric and set out to avenge your fallen comrades from an evil dragon. IT'S CLERIC DE COMMANDO!

Source: The Developer Website.

201491.name: The Dweller
201491.description:
User Summary

The Dweller is a puzzle game where you play as the MONSTER!

201492.name: City Play
201492.description:
CityPlay is a city builder simulator! Create your own dream city.

Source: The Developer Website.

201493.name: The Way
201493.description:
Journey to another planet and discover its secrets in order to bring your loved one back to life. Experience an adventure, inspired by old school classics like Another World, Heart of Darkness and Flashback.

Source: The Game Website.

201494.name: Trinium Wars
201494.description:
User Summary

Despite its scifi post-apocalyptic theme, this MMO is a lot like World of Warcraft from 10 years earlier. There are interesting crafting and vehicle options as well as myth backgrounding but there is also a cash store as well as a short overall storyline. The game has a growing reputation of being one of the worst MMORPGs.

201495.name: LASTFIGHT
201495.description:
LASTFIGHT is bringing 2v2 3D fighting back to your living room! Pick up any available object in one of the 8 stages and teach your opponents a lesson!

Source: The Game Website.

201496.name: Tales from the Void
201496.description:
Lost in time and space and fighting for survival, it is up to you to save the crew of a World War I submarine in Tales from the Void, a squad-based, atmospheric real time tactics game.

Source: The Game Website.

201497.name: The Leisure of Grisaia
videogamehonor: 2015 Operation Rainfall Awards Hottest Guy of the Year Winner
201497.description:
User Summary

This time, it's Michiru who takes the lead role in this slapstick comedy.

201498.name: LightWalk
201498.description:
User Summary

A 2D Puzzle Platformer about navigating mazes of lasers.

201499.name: A Little Lily Princess
201499.description:
Newly arrived at a boarding school in Victorian England, Sara Crewe uses her love of books and storytelling to build new relationships. But what happens to a fairy-tale princess when she loses everything?

Source: The Publisher Website.

201500.name: The Mims Beginning
201500.description:
Experience the mysterious and mystical by taking on a journey with Mims in this strategic god-like game. Create structures, plant vegetation, breed animals, take care of your minions, use divine PSI powers, triumph in face of natural disasters, fight monsters, predict the future, and so much more.

Source: The Game Website.
